blog.name: thefeministherald
blog.title: The Feminist Herald
blog.description: Brief Feminist Updates.  Feminism: Supporting the fight against the oppression of women through activism and the interrogation of the tools used to create and perpetuate a social system that oppresses women in order to afford privilege to men, especially white men. Tools like misogynistic narratives, ideas and attitudes and their use in politics, the media, education and all other social institutions and constructs. In addition, examining and pointing out how racism, homophobia and other oppressive systems and forms of discrimination intersect with misogynistic ideas creating hybrid attitudes, narratives and ideas against women of color, LGBT women, women with disabilities and other women who face those forms of discrimination.

summary: Captain Marvel's Getting a Badass, Post-Apocalyptic New Look
body:
Captain Marvel’s Getting a Badass, Post-Apocalyptic New Look

in the character’s upcoming series from writer Kelly Thompson and artist Carmen Carnero, she’s slated to switch up her look once more as she battles her latest foe.

…

Basically all of Carol’s new girl gang are sporting costumes pulled right out of Fury Road, which makes a certain amount of sense considering that most of their powers involve a degree of being able to tolerate radiation. Echo’s the notable exception, and it’ll be interesting to see how she factors into the team because of her comparatively more street-level fighting abilities when the new Captain Marvel series hits stores on January 2.

summary: I had always thought Deathbird was a Dave Cockrum creation but the visual evidently came from the pencil of Keith Pollard. Ms....
body: I had always thought Deathbird was a Dave Cockrum creation but the visual evidently came from the pencil of Keith Pollard. Ms. Marvel #22, February 1979. Cover artists Dave Cockrum and Terry Austin.
